message: The xml:id of the TEI element should be equal to the name of the file, without the file extension. Currently the value of xml:id is "SSK_sc_DisseminationFieldSurveys" whilst the file name is "SSK_sc_DisseminationFieldSurveys.xml"
TEI/@type should be either "researchScenario" or "researchStep". The current value of TEI/@type is "researchScenario"

test: tei:date and tei:persName and tei:affiliation and tei:desc
message: When recording a revision, some precise metadata must be given : the date of the revision, the name of the responsibe and his/her affiliation and a description.

nodeText:
A researcher wants to preserve and to give
                    access to field surveys and their related materials. Indeed, to provide a
                    consistent context and make the reuse of raw data easier, the documentation has
                    to include not only field materials but also documents about the research
                    process steps, that’s to say the preparation of the survey (research project,
                    funding file, etc.), the field collection (interviews, field notebooks, etc.)
                    and the data analysis (summary sheets, drafts, etc.). This corpus can thus cover
                    a great variety of media (paper, digital, picture, audio or video records…) and
                    is organised according to a classification plan. It is supposed that people
                    interested have agreed that data will be made public available (potentially with
                    some restrictions).
message: In the <desc type="definition>, there should be nothing more than text, <list> and <ref>.
sourceDesc in mandatory in TEI, so if you want to give details on the way the scenario was conceived, it is the appropriate location.

nodeText:
Encode and modelize field surveys for their
                    online dissemination
message: The title of a scenario should describe the main goal of the scenario.
A scenario could have several keywords related to standards. Check the documentation for more details
A scenario could have several keywords related to research techniques. Check the Tadirah taxonomy for more details.
A scenario could have several keywords related to research objects. Check the Tadirah taxonomy for more details.
